name: Epidemiology and Laboratory Capacity for Infectious Diseases (ELC)
objective: The purpose of this program is to protect the public health and safety of the American people by enhancing the capacity of public health agencies to effectively detect, respond, prevent and control known and emerging (or re-emerging) infectious diseases. This is accomplished by providing financial and technical resources to: (1) strengthen epidemiologic capacity; (2) enhance laboratory capacity; (3) improve health information systems; and (4) enhance collaboration among epidemiology, laboratory, and information systems components of public health departments.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services
sub_agency_name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
applicant_types: Local (includes State-designated Indian Tribes, excludes institutions of higher education and hospitals

authorizations.text: Pub. L. Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PL 111-148) (42 USC 300hh-31).

rules_regulations: Basic grant administration policies of DHHS and PHS are applicable, 45 CFR 75, HHS Grants Policy Statement
